definition:
A topological space $X$ is called *totally disconnected* if all
connected components of $X$ are singletons.

Examples of totally disconnected spaces include:

-   Every discrete space,

-   Cantor set,

-   the set of rational numbers ${\mathbb{Q}}$ endowed with the subspace
    topology induced by ${\mathbb{Q}}\hookrightarrow {\mathbb{R}}$ and,

-   the set of irrational numbers ${\mathbb{R}}\setminus{\mathbb{Q}}$
    again with the subspace topology.
